javadoc: A utility class to manage LookAndFeel (LaF) settings.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the {@link Preferences} value for whether to use inverted colors when paiting.
@return the {@link Preferences} value for whether to use inverted colors when paiting.
methods.name: getUseInvertedColorsPreference
methods.comment: Returns the Preferences value for whether to use inverted colors when paiting.

return.comment: the Preferences value for whether to use inverted colors when paiting.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the currently installed LaF.
@return the currently installed LaF.
methods.name: getInstalledLookAndFeelName

methods.javadoc:
Set the look and feel (LAF) indicated by the string passed in as a parameter. The string value can be either the class name of the LAF, as returned by LookAndFeelInfo.getClassName() or the name as returned by LookAndFeelInfo.getName().

Note: to be effective, this call needs to be made before any components have been created and shown. @param lookAndFeelName the string indicating which look and feel is desired (see above)
methods.name: setLookAndFeel
methods.comment:
Set the look and feel (LAF) indicated by the string passed in as a parameter.  
 The string value can be either the class name of the LAF, as returned by 
 LookAndFeelInfo.getClassName() or the name as returned by 
 LookAndFeelInfo.getName().
 
 Note: to be effective, this call needs to be made before any components have been created
 and shown.

params.name: lookAndFeelName
params.comment: the string indicating which look and feel is desired (see above)

methods.javadoc:
Returns all installed LaFs.  This will vary by OS.
@return all installed LaFs.
methods.name: getLookAndFeelNames
methods.comment: Returns all installed LaFs.  This will vary by OS.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the given UI object is using the Aqua Look and Feel.
@param UI the UI to examine.
methods.name: isUsingAquaUI
methods.comment: Returns true if the given UI object is using the Aqua Look and Feel.

name: DockingWindowsLookAndFeelUtils
comment: A utility class to manage LookAndFeel (LaF) settings.

fields.javadoc: Preference name for look and feel for the application.
fields.name: LAST_LOOK_AND_FEEL_KEY
fields.comment: Preference name for look and feel for the application.

fields.javadoc: Preference name for whether to use inverted colors.
fields.name: USE_INVERTED_COLORS_KEY
fields.comment: Preference name for whether to use inverted colors.

fields.javadoc: Metal is the non-system, generic Java Look and Feel.
fields.name: METAL_LOOK_AND_FEEL
fields.comment: Metal is the non-system, generic Java Look and Feel.
